page.title: 13LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: The Old Vicarage built 1875 on site of pub "Golden Eagle" and Smithy. These moved to cottages on main road. Now only "The Eagle" exists. Smith-Dorri- ens employed their own village carpenters,bricklayers, ect.,but some of the population worked in boot factories in Cheshem. With improved methods of arable farming many agric- ultural workers returned to the land. In 1923 ten council cottages were built to rehouse land workers. Once only 15 dwellings surounded the green, today over 100.The Memorial Hall built after the 1914-18 war replaced by larger R.A.F. hut in 1966 now the Village Hall. Two Dells Lane named after two brothers of Little Harriotts Farm.Hogg Lane called after a man named Hogg who drove pigs along the pathway.Johnslane was St.Johns Lane and led to St.Johns Well,Berkhamsted.
